availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Scott Wray (Wayne County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Wray. Father of Matthew E. Wray, John P. Wray, William E. Wray, George A. Wray, Lovel D. F. Wray, and Virginia J. Wray. Farmer and merchant in Wayne County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Wayne, Mill Springs, p. 120. Find A Grave, “John Scott Wray (February 7, 1809-April 18, 1864),” Memorial #30651590, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=30651590 (accessed June 3, 2017).
